articles.title: Theory-driven Analysis for Ecological Data
articles.contents:
The objective of this five-day workshop, co-organized by the FRB-CESAB
and the GdR
TheoMoDive is to train young researchers in theory-based approaches
to model ecological data (e.g. temporal series, macroecology,
interaction and trophic network, etc.).
The first edition of this training course will take place from the
16th to the 20th of May 2022 in the CESAB premises in Montpellier.

Program
General schedule:
09:00-10:45 - Courses10:45-11:00 -
Coffee break11:00-12:30 - Courses12h30-14:00 - Lunch14:00-15:45
- Practices15:45-16:00 - Coffee break16:00-17:30 - Practices17:30-18:00 -
Break18:00-19:00 - Guest speaker

Day 1
Speaker: Isabelle Gounand
    
  Icebreaker and introduction of the week
    
  Introduction to modelling and theory
    
  Guest speaker: Kim Cuddington (Waterloo
Univ., Canada)

Day 2
Speakers: Emanuel Fronhofer, Benjamin
Rosenbaum, Camille Saade
    
  Temporal series and dynamics in ecology
    
  Guest speaker: Frédéric Barraquand (CNRS,
Bordeaux)

Day 3
Speakers: Vincent Calcagno, Maxime
Dubart
    
  Spatial data, macro-ecology and co-occurrences
    
  Guest speaker: Virginie Ravigné (CIRAD,
Montpellier)

Day 4
Speakers: François Massol, Claire Jacquet,
Matthieu Barbier
    
  Interaction networks, trophic networks, and complexity in ecology
    
  Guest speaker: Sonia Kéfi (CNRS,
Montpellier)

Day 5
    
  Subgroups projects

Prerequisites
Please follow this tutorial to
correctly install your working environment (R, RStudio, R packages,
etc.).
Corrections
If you see mistakes or want to suggest changes, please Create
an issue on the source repository.
Reuse
The material of this website is licensed under Creative Commons
Attribution CC BY
4.0. Source code is available at https://github.com/theodatasci/theodatasci.github.io/.
Citation
Calcagno V, Fronhofer EA, Gounand I & Massol F (2022) Workshop
FRB-CESAB & GdR TheoMoDive: Theory-driven Analysis for Ecological
Data (Edition 2022).
